page.title: 07SECRETARY FOR EDUCATION
page.content: In 1950 Mr Norman Barr began work in North Devon as a teacher. Later, in Derbyshire,an opportunity came for him to enter administration. He became Deputy Secretary for Educa- tion in Cornwall in 1976 and Secretary in 1982. His job includes writing letters, ordering school meals supplies,dealing with college grants and keeping records. His favourite tasks are going into primary schools and talking to teachers. If he had not gone into Education he might have become a linguist, mathema- tician, farmer or even a professional gardener. Mr Barr lives in Perranwell. He likes it there because the village people get on well together. He chose his house because it suited his family and there were plenty of trees.
